intro: Senecillis jaluensis, commonly known as the Jaluensis Senecillis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its flowers bloom in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
